Docs.summary: Base class that represents the kernel of a shader.

remarks.para: Application developers should not create instances of this class directly. Instead, developers should use any fo the numerous shaders that derive from this class that Metal Performance Shaders provides.

To use a shader, application developers: first instantiate one (For example, ); set properties on the shader and encode it to a , optionally encoding other operations on it; and, finally, commit the command buffer to be run.
